diff_hunk:
@@ -254,6 +254,49 @@ def f(x, y):
         self.assertExpectedGraph(trace)
         self.assertExportImport(trace, (x, y))
 
+    def test_peephole(self):
+        a = torch.tensor([0.4], requires_grad=True)
+        b = torch.tensor([0.7], requires_grad=True)
+        c = torch.tensor([0.4, 0.5], requires_grad=True)
+        d = torch.tensor([0], dtype=torch.int32)
+
+        def f(x, y):
+            return x.type_as(y)
+
+        trace, z = torch.jit.get_trace_graph(f, (a, b))
+        self.run_pass('peephole', trace)
+        self.assertExpectedGraph(trace, subname="same_size")
+        trace, z = torch.jit.get_trace_graph(f, (a, c))
+        self.run_pass('peephole', trace)
+        self.assertExpectedGraph(trace, subname="different_size")
+        trace, z = torch.jit.get_trace_graph(f, (a, d))
+        self.run_pass('peephole', trace)
+        self.assertExpectedGraph(trace, subname="different_type")
+
+    def test_peephole_dynamic(self):
+        def f(x, y):
+            return x.type_as(y)
+
+        fn = torch.jit.script(f)
+        torch._C._jit_pass_peephole(fn.graph)
+        self.assertExpectedGraph(fn.graph)
body: The reason why I'd like to test that case is to make sure we have the expected behavior when the type_as is trying to cast between dynamic types, which is supposed to be a no-op. By running in script mode,  I could obtain the unannotated graph so that we can test the case as expected.
